hero.title: Me, You, We!
hero.description: We advocate Free and open-source software.

transparent.title: Transparent
transparent.description: FOSS provides access to the source code of the software, allowing users to examine how the software works. This ensures software respects their privacy claims for example.

secure.title: Secure
secure.description: FOSS projects often have active communities that are on the lookout for security issues. They are also quick to respond to these security vulnerabilities.

active.title: Active
active.description: The communities behind FOSS listen to user feedback and issues, and are prompt to work out solutions to accommodate.

freedoms.title: The four essential freedoms
freedoms.subtitle: These freedoms have been set by the gnu.org website to define open-source.

freedom0.title: Freedom 0
freedom0.definition: The freedom to run the program as you wish, for any purpose.

freedom1.title: Freedom 1
freedom1.definition: The freedom to study how the program works, and change it so it does your computing as you wish.

freedom2.title: Freedom 2
freedom2.definition: The freedom to redistribute copies so you can help others.

freedom3.title: Freedom 3
freedom3.definition: The freedom to distribute copies of your modified versions to others.
